Tags Display Mode in Author mode

body.p: You can control the amount of markup that is displayed in the Author mode with various levels of tag modes for both block and inline elements.
The following dedicated tag modes are available from the Tags Display Mode drop-down menu (available on the toolbar):

dlentry.dd: Displays full tag names with attributes for both block and inline elements.
Displays full tag names without attributes for both block and inline elements.
Displays full tag names for block elements and simple tags without names for inline elements.
Displays full tag names for inline elements, while block elements are not displayed.
Displays simple tags without names for inline elements, while block elements are not displayed.
No tags are displayed. This is the most compact mode and is as close as possible to a word-processor view.

Use this option to go to the Author preferences page where you can configure the Tags options, such as the default Tags display mode, Tags background color, Tags foreground color, Tags font, and if should use a Compact tag layout for displaying the tags by trying to group consecutive block tags on the same line.

p.note: The associated CSS information is used to determine weather a tag should be considered inline or block. If the current document does not have an associated CSS stylesheet, then the Full Tags mode will be used.
